### Government Tender Announcement

**Title** {#title}
------------

B8845-20240131 Mini-Documentary Video Series and Shorter ‘Teaser’ Videos

**Reference Number** {#reference-number}
----------------------

WS4279494212-Doc4298652317

**Solicitation Number** {#solicitation-number}
-------------------------

WS4279494212

**Request for Proposal**

The Department of Public Works and Government Services, on behalf of the Department of Citizenship and Immigration, invites proposals from qualified vendors to develop a series of mini-documentary videos and shorter teaser-style videos for the Immigration Matters campaign.

**Project Objectives** {#project-objectives}
-------------------------

The primary objective of this project is to create new video content that highlights the positive contributions of immigrants to communities across Canada. The mini-documentary videos will follow a consistent format, style, and tone, exploring the stories of different communities and their experiences with immigration.

**Key Requirements** {#key-requirements}
------------------------

*   Develop 5-10 new mini-documentary videos and a series of teaser-style videos
*   Collaborate with the Department of Citizenship and Immigration to ensure the content meets their requirements
*   Align the content with the existing Immigration Matters campaign
*   Deliver high-quality video content that is engaging, informative, and accessible to a broad audience

**Contract Details** {#contract-details}
-------------------------

*   **Contracting Entity:** Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
*   **Regions of Delivery:** Canada
*   **Expected Contract Start Date:** December 15, 2023
*   **Expected Contract End Date:** None
*   **Evaluation Criteria:** Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price

**Bid Submission Instructions**

To submit a bid, please click on the third tab (Bidding Details) and login or create an Ariba account. For more information, please visit the link below:

**Contact Information**

For more information, please contact Marc Roussel at marc.roussel@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
